name: Slashdot - That Classic Feeling
description:
Tries to undo the Beta changes to Slashdot.

With the failure of Slashdot Beta, Dice stated they would leave Slashdot alone, only making incremental changes "where they make sense".  What this really means is that they're slowly rolling up Beta changes into the main site.  This style tries to undo or at least make these changes palatable.
additional_info:
We've lost that claaaasic feeeeelin'... Tries to undo the Beta changes to the Slashdot. With the failure of Slashdot Beta, Dice stated they would leave Slashdot alone, only making incremental changes "where they make sense". What this really means is that they're slowly rolling up Beta changes into the main site. This style tries to undo or at least make these changes palatable. Comments / suggestions / forks / whatever welcome. Changes:
  • Removes Share crap.
  • Moves the new "comment bubble" so that it's back under the article summary.
  • Adjusts the article image so it's not covering the title.
  • Minimizes video articles.
  • Removes Slashdot Deals.
  • Removes sponsored content articles.
This also effects similar listing pages, such as the list of user comments and journals, etc. Various Rationale: Share links are damned stupid. Having the number of comments left-aligned with the article titles makes it a lot easier to scan down the page looking for interesting posts. It also is easier to see and click on. Moving the images down a little prevents them from completely covering the article title. Changelog: 1.0: Posted to userstyles, woo! 1.1: Update for changes to comment bubbles on collapsed articles. 1.2: Remove new share buttons. Fix poll comment bubbles. 1.2.1: Update for changes to share links (janrainsocial). 1.2.2: Fix Firehose articles. Remove Slashdot Deals. 1.3: Slashdot updated: Remove styles for videos and polls in the article list. 1.3.1: Hide "sponsored" articles 1.3.2: Deal with inline style on "sponsored" articles 1.3.3: Remove image adjustment and tweak comment bubble placement
